dom-payererrors-email.name: email
dom-payererrors-email.summary: The email property is included in a PayerErrors object if the PaymentResponse.payerEmail property failed validation; in this case, the property should contain a string describing how to correct the problem. If the payer's email address passed validation, this property is not included in the PayerErrors object.

firefox.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

firefox_android.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

dom-payererrors-email.title: PayerErrors.email

dom-payererrors-name.name: name
dom-payererrors-name.summary: The name property is included in a PayerErrors object if the payerName returned in the response couldn't be validated. The value is a string explaining the problem. If the payer's name validated successfully, the name property is omitted from the PayerErrors object.

firefox.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

firefox_android.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

dom-payererrors-name.title: PayerErrors.name

dom-payererrors-phone.name: phone
dom-payererrors-phone.summary: The phone property is found in a PayerErrors object if the payerName returned in the response couldn't be validated as a valid phone number. The value of this property is a string explaining the problem. If the payer's phone number validated successfully, the phone property is omitted from the PayerErrors object.

firefox.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

firefox_android.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

dom-payererrors-phone.title: PayerErrors.phone

dom-payererrors.name: PayerErrors
dom-payererrors.summary: The PayerErrors dictionary is used by the Payment Request API to indicate the presence of—and to explain how to correct—validation errors in the payer details.

firefox.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

firefox_android.notes: Enabled by default in nightly US English builds of Firefox 64 and later, and on other localizations when geolocation indicates the user is in the United States or Canada.

dom-payererrors.title: PayerErrors

dom-paymentaddress-addressline.name: addressLine
dom-paymentaddress-addressline.summary: The addressLine read-only property of the PaymentAddress interface is an array of DOMString objects, each specifying a line of the address that is not covered by one of the other properties of PaymentAddress.
dom-paymentaddress-addressline.title: PaymentAddress.addressLine

dom-paymentaddress-city.name: city
dom-paymentaddress-city.summary: The city read-only property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing the city or town portion of the address.
dom-paymentaddress-city.title: PaymentAddress.city

dom-paymentaddress.name: country
dom-paymentaddress.summary: The country read-only property of the PaymentAddress interface is a string identifying the address's country using the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard. The string is always in its canonical upper-case form.
dom-paymentaddress.title: PaymentAddress.country

dom-paymentaddress-dependentlocality.name: dependentLocality
dom-paymentaddress-dependentlocality.summary: The read-only dependentLocality property of the PaymentAddress interface is a string containing a sublocality designation within a city, such as a  neighborhood, borough, district, or, in the United Kingdom, a dependent locality. Also known as a post town.
dom-paymentaddress-dependentlocality.title: PaymentAddress.dependentLocality

dom-paymentaddress-organization.name: organization
dom-paymentaddress-organization.summary: The organization read-only property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing the name of the organization, firm, company, or institution at the address.
dom-paymentaddress-organization.title: PaymentAddress.organization

dom-paymentaddress-phone.name: phone
dom-paymentaddress-phone.summary: The read-only phone property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing the telephone number of the recipient or contact person.
dom-paymentaddress-phone.title: PaymentAddress.phone

dom-paymentaddress-postalcode.name: postalCode
dom-paymentaddress-postalcode.summary: The postalCode read-only property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing a code used by a jurisdiction for mail routing, for example, the ZIP Code in the United States or the Postal Index Number (PIN code) in India.
dom-paymentaddress-postalcode.title: PaymentAddress.postalCode

dom-paymentaddress-recipient.name: recipient
dom-paymentaddress-recipient.summary: The read-only recipient property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing the name of the recipient, purchaser, or contact person at the payment address.
dom-paymentaddress-recipient.title: PaymentAddress.recipient

dom-paymentaddress-region.name: region
dom-paymentaddress-region.summary: The read-only region property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing the top-level administrative subdivision of the country in which the address is located. For example, this may be a state, province, oblast, or prefecture.
dom-paymentaddress-region.title: PaymentAddress.region

dom-paymentaddress-sortingcode.name: sortingCode
dom-paymentaddress-sortingcode.summary: The sortingCode read-only property of the PaymentAddress interface returns a string containing a postal sorting code such as is used in France.
dom-paymentaddress-sortingcode.title: PaymentAddress.sortingCode

paymentaddress-interface.name: PaymentAddress
paymentaddress-interface.summary: The PaymentAddress interface of the Payment Request API is used to store shipping or payment address information.

firefox.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

firefox_android.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

paymentaddress-interface.title: PaymentAddress

dom-paymentcurrencyamount-currency.name: currency
dom-paymentcurrencyamount-currency.summary: The PaymentCurrencyAmount property currency is a string which specifies the currency in which the value is specified.
dom-paymentcurrencyamount-currency.title: PaymentCurrencyAmount.currency

dom-paymentcurrencyamount.name: currencySystem
dom-paymentcurrencyamount.summary: The obsolete PaymentCurrencyAmount property currencySystem is a string which specifies the standard being used to specify the currency the value is specified in.

firefox.notes: Removed from the specification; currencies are now always identified using ISO 4217. This was only available in nightly builds.

firefox_android.notes: Removed from the specification; currencies are now always identified using ISO 4217. This was only available in nightly builds.

dom-paymentcurrencyamount.title: PaymentCurrencyAmount.currencySystem

dom-paymentcurrencyamount.name: currencySystem
dom-paymentcurrencyamount.summary: The obsolete PaymentCurrencyAmount property currencySystem is a string which specifies the standard being used to specify the currency the value is specified in.

firefox.notes: Removed from the specification; currencies are now always identified using ISO 4217. This was only available in nightly builds.

firefox_android.notes: Removed from the specification; currencies are now always identified using ISO 4217. This was only available in nightly builds.

dom-paymentcurrencyamount.title: PaymentCurrencyAmount.currencySystem

dom-paymentcurrencyamount.name: PaymentCurrencyAmount
dom-paymentcurrencyamount.summary: The PaymentCurrencyAmount dictionary describes an amount of money in terms of both a number of units and the currency (US dollars, Euro, yen, etc.), and is part of the Payment Request API.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA.

dom-paymentcurrencyamount.title: PaymentCurrencyAmount

dom-paymentcurrencyamount-value.name: value
dom-paymentcurrencyamount-value.summary: The PaymentCurrencyAmount property value is a string containing the decimal numeric value of the payment, specified in the currency units indicated by the currency property.
dom-paymentcurrencyamount-value.title: PaymentCurrencyAmount.value

dom-paymentdetailsbase.name: PaymentDetailsBase
dom-paymentdetailsbase.summary: The PaymentDetailsBase dictionary is a mixin used by the PaymentDetailsInit and PaymentDetailsUpdate dictionaries.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA.

dom-paymentdetailsbase.title: PaymentDetailsBase

dom-paymentdetailsupdate-error.name: error
dom-paymentdetailsupdate-error.summary: The PaymentDetailsUpdate dictionary's error property is a human-readable DOMString which provides an error message to be displayed if the specified information doesn't offer any valid shipping options.
dom-paymentdetailsupdate-error.title: PaymentDetailsUpdate.error

dom-paymentdetailsupdate-shippingaddress.name: shippingAddressErrors
dom-paymentdetailsupdate-shippingaddress.summary: The PaymentDetailsUpdate dictionary's shippingAddressErrors property, if present,  contains an AddressErrors object whose contents provide error messages for one or more of the values in the PaymentAddress specified as PaymentRequest.shippingAddress.
dom-paymentdetailsupdate-shippingaddress.title: PaymentDetailsUpdate.shippingAddressErrors

dom-paymentdetailsupdate.name: PaymentDetailsUpdate
dom-paymentdetailsupdate.summary: The PaymentDetailsUpdate dictionary is used to provide updated information to the payment user interface after it has been instantiated.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA.

dom-paymentdetailsupdate.title: PaymentDetailsUpdate

dom-paymentitem.name: PaymentItem
dom-paymentitem.summary: The PaymentItem dictionary is used by the Payment Request API to describe a single line item on a payment request.

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA).

flags.name: dom.payments.request.supportedRegions
flags.value_to_set: A comma-delineated list of one or more 2-character ISO country codes indicating the countries in which to support payments (for example, US,CA).

dom-paymentitem.title: PaymentItem

dom-paymentmethodchangeevent-methoddetai.name: methodDetails
dom-paymentmethodchangeevent-methoddetai.summary: PaymentMethodChangeEvent interface is an object containing any data the payment handler may provide to describe the change the user has made to their payment method.
dom-paymentmethodchangeevent-methoddetai.title: PaymentMethodChangeEvent.methodDetails

dom-paymentmethodchangeevent-methodname.name: methodName
dom-paymentmethodchangeevent-methodname.summary: PaymentMethodChangeEvent interface is a string which uniquely identifies the payment handler currently selected by the user.
dom-paymentmethodchangeevent-methodname.title: PaymentMethodChangeEvent.methodName

paymentmethodchangeevent-interface.name: PaymentMethodChangeEvent
paymentmethodchangeevent-interface.summary: The PaymentMethodChangeEvent interface of the Payment Request API describes the paymentmethodchange event which is fired by some payment handlers when the user switches payment instruments (e.g., a user selects a "store" card to make a purchase while using Apple Pay).

firefox.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

firefox_android.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

paymentmethodchangeevent-interface.title: PaymentMethodChangeEvent

constructor.name: PaymentRequest
constructor.summary: The PaymentRequest() constructor creates a new PaymentRequest object which will be used to handle the process of generating, validating, and submitting a payment request.
constructor.title: PaymentRequest.PaymentRequest()

dom-paymentrequest-abort.name: abort
dom-paymentrequest-abort.summary: The PaymentRequest.abort() method of the PaymentRequest interface causes the user agent to end the payment request and to remove any user interface that might be shown.
dom-paymentrequest-abort.title: PaymentRequest.abort()

canmakepayment-method.name: canMakePayment
canmakepayment-method.summary: The PaymentRequest method canMakePayment() determines whether or not the request is configured in a way that is compatible with at least one payment method supported by the user agent.
canmakepayment-method.title: PaymentRequest.canMakePayment()

dom-paymentrequest-id.name: id
dom-paymentrequest-id.summary: The id read-only attribute of the PaymentRequest interface returns a unique identifier for a particular PaymentRequest instance.
dom-paymentrequest-id.title: PaymentRequest.prototype.id

onpaymentmethodchange-attribute.name: onpaymentmethodchange
onpaymentmethodchange-attribute.summary: The PaymentRequest event handler onpaymentmethodchange is invoked when the paymentmethodchange
onpaymentmethodchange-attribute.title: PaymentRequest.onpaymentmethodchange

onshippingaddresschange-attribute.name: onshippingaddresschange
onshippingaddresschange-attribute.summary: The onshippingaddresschange event of the PaymentRequest interface is fired whenever the user changes their shipping address, including when an address is added by the user for the first time.
onshippingaddresschange-attribute.title: PaymentRequest.onshippingaddresschange

onshippingoptionchange-attribute.name: onshippingoptionchange
onshippingoptionchange-attribute.summary: The onshippingoptionchange event of the PaymentRequest interface is fired whenever the user changes a shipping option.
onshippingoptionchange-attribute.title: PaymentRequest.onshippingoptionchange

dfn-paymentmethodchange.name: paymentmethodchange_event
dfn-paymentmethodchange.summary: paymentmethodchange events are delivered by the Payment Request API to a PaymentRequest object when the user changes payment methods within a given payment handler.
dfn-paymentmethodchange.title: PaymentRequest: paymentmethodchange event

dfn-shippingaddresschange.name: shippingaddresschange_event
dfn-shippingaddresschange.summary: The shippingaddresschange event is sent to the PaymentRequest object when the user selects a shipping address or changes details of their shipping address.
dfn-shippingaddresschange.title: PaymentRequest: shippingaddresschange event

shippingoption-attribute.name: shippingOption
shippingoption-attribute.summary: The shippingOption read-only attribute of the PaymentRequest interface returns either the id of a selected shipping option, null (if no shipping option was set to be selected) or a shipping option selected by the user. It is initially null by when no "selected" shipping options are provided.
shippingoption-attribute.title: PaymentRequest.shippingOption

dfn-shippingoptionchange.name: shippingoptionchange_event
dfn-shippingoptionchange.summary: For payment requests that request shipping information, and for which shipping options are offered, the shippingoptionchange event is sent to the PaymentRequest whenever the user chooses a shipping option from the list of available options.
dfn-shippingoptionchange.title: PaymentRequest: shippingoptionchange event

dom-paymentrequest-shippingtype.name: shippingType
dom-paymentrequest-shippingtype.summary: The shippingType read-only property of the PaymentRequest interface returns one of "shipping", "delivery", "pickup", or null if one was not provided by the constructor.
dom-paymentrequest-shippingtype.title: PaymentRequest.shippingType

show-method.name: show
show-method.summary: The PaymentRequest interface's show() method instructs the user agent to begin the process of showing and handling the user interface for the payment request to the user.
show-method.title: PaymentRequest.show()

paymentrequest-interface.name: PaymentRequest
paymentrequest-interface.summary: The Payment Request API's PaymentRequest interface the primary access point into the API, and lets web content and apps accept payments from the end user on behalf of the operator of the site or the publisher of the app.

firefox.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

firefox_android.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

paymentrequest-interface.title: PaymentRequest

constructor-0.name: PaymentRequestUpdateEvent
constructor-0.summary: The PaymentRequestUpdateEvent constructor creates a new PaymentRequestUpdateEvent object which enables a web page to update the details of a PaymentRequest in response to a user action. Actual updates are made by passing options to the updateWith() method.
constructor-0.title: PaymentRequestUpdateEvent.PaymentRequestUpdateEvent()

updatewith-method.name: updateWith
updatewith-method.summary: The updateWith() method of the PaymentRequestUpdateEvent interface updates the details of an existing PaymentRequest.
updatewith-method.title: PaymentRequestUpdateEvent.updateWith()

paymentrequestupdateevent-interface.name: PaymentRequestUpdateEvent
paymentrequestupdateevent-interface.summary: The PaymentRequestUpdateEvent interface is used for events sent to a PaymentRequest instance when changes are made to shipping-related information for a pending PaymentRequest. Those events are:

firefox.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

firefox_android.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

paymentrequestupdateevent-interface.title: PaymentRequestUpdateEvent

dom-paymentresponse-complete.name: complete
dom-paymentresponse-complete.summary: The PaymentRequest method complete() of the Payment Request API notifies the user agent that the user interaction is over, and causes any remaining user interface to be closed.
dom-paymentresponse-complete.title: PaymentResponse.complete()

dom-paymentresponse-onpayerdetailchange.name: onpayerdetailchange
dom-paymentresponse-onpayerdetailchange.summary: The PaymentResponse object's onpayerdetailchange property is an event handler which is called to handle the payerdetailchange event, which is sent to the PaymentResponse when the user makes changes to their personal information while filling out a payment request form.
dom-paymentresponse-onpayerdetailchange.title: PaymentResponse.onpayerdetailchange

dfn-payerdetailchange.name: payerdetailchange_event
dfn-payerdetailchange.summary: payerdetailchange events are delivered by the Payment Request API to a PaymentResponse object when the user makes changes to their personal information while filling out a payment request form.
dfn-payerdetailchange.title: PaymentResponse: payerdetailchange event

dom-paymentresponse-payername.name: payerName
dom-paymentresponse-payername.summary: The payerName read-only property of the PaymentResponse interface returns the name supplied by the user. This option is only present when the requestPayerName option is set to true in the options parameter of the PaymentRequest() constructor.
dom-paymentresponse-payername.title: PaymentRequest.payerName

dom-paymentresponse-requestid.name: requestId
dom-paymentresponse-requestid.summary: The requestId read-only property of the PaymentResponse interface rreturns the free-form identifier supplied by the PaymentResponse() constructor by details.id.
dom-paymentresponse-requestid.title: PaymentResponse.requestId

dom-paymentresponse-retry.name: retry
dom-paymentresponse-retry.summary: The PaymentResponse interface's retry() method makes it possible to ask the user to retry a payment after an error occurs during processing.
dom-paymentresponse-retry.title: PaymentResponse.retry()

paymentresponse-interface.name: PaymentResponse
paymentresponse-interface.summary: The PaymentResponse interface of the Payment Request API is returned after a user selects a payment method and approves a payment request.

firefox.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

firefox_android.notes: Available only in nightly builds. Requires dom.payments.request.enabled to be set to true and the comma-delineated list in dom.payments.request.supportedRegions to contain one or more of the supported 2-character ISO locales, currently US and CA.

paymentresponse-interface.title: PaymentResponse
